docs.text:
Overview


The Shopping List App developed by AFMussap Tech is the simplest way to organize your grocery lists. Its main feature, the integration with Google's native voice recognition, allows you to 
 speak 
 the items you to want to include in the list, which saves a lot of time and typing.


Other features include:




Create multiple shopping lists with different colors.


Edit and delete lists and items


To group items using a simple color system


Sum of purchases as each item is inserted.




No more lists on scraps of papers! Download the AFMussap Tech Shopping List App and start to organize your shop now. It's free!


Available for Android™.
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: The Shopping List App developed by AFMussap Tech is the simplest way to organize your grocery lists. Its main feature, the integration with Google's native voice recognition, allows you to   speak   the items you to want to include in the list, which saves a lot of time and typing.  Other features include:   Create multiple shopping lists with different colors.  Edit and delete lists and items  To group items using a simple color system  Sum of purchases as each item is inserted.   No more lists on scraps of papers! Download the AFMussap Tech Shopping List App and start to organize your shop now. It's free!  Available for Android™.
docs.title: Overview

docs.text:
Download and Install Shopping List


The easiest way to download and install the Shopping List App developed by AFMussap Tech in your smartphone is to 
click here
 and access it straightway on Google Play. 


Also, you can go to Google Play and search for 
AFMussap




In the search results, tap the App to access it and click 
Install
.






We don't advise you to search for 
Shopping List
 on Google Play because this will display a lot of other Apps in the result list, and this can make it harder for you to find our App. 




The Shopping List App requires 
Android 4.0.3 and up
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: The easiest way to download and install the Shopping List App developed by AFMussap Tech in your smartphone is to  click here  and access it straightway on Google Play.   Also, you can go to Google Play and search for  AFMussap   In the search results, tap the App to access it and click  Install .    We don't advise you to search for  Shopping List  on Google Play because this will display a lot of other Apps in the result list, and this can make it harder for you to find our App.    The Shopping List App requires  Android 4.0.3 and up
docs.title: Download and Install Shopping List

docs.text:
Tutorial - Items


After you follow the steps from the previous tutorial - 
Custom Lists
 - and create a new list you can start to add items to it.


Add Items to the List


To create a new Item, tap the button 'Add'




On the window 
Add a new item
, you can type a name or use Google's native voice recognition to add an item to the list.






After write or speech the name of the item, tap 
NEW
 to add the item to the list. 




The list is ordered alphabetically.




It's possible to use the colour system to group items by section or similarity. This helps you to save time while doing your shopping. For example, for a market shopping list you can group fruits and vegetables in green, frozen food in blue, bakery in pink, etc.




Example of a list using different colours








Each coloured block is a sub-list inside your list.




While shopping, once you put an item into the basket, select it (
strikethrough it
) for you to know what's already purchased. To select an item, just tap it. 


The selected item is sent to the end of the list of the coloured block that it belongs.




Example of a list with selected (
strikethrough
) items






To deselect an item, tap it again.


Edit or Delete an Item


You can edit an item to change its name or its color. For that, slide it to the right and tap the button 
Settings




In the same way, to delete an item, slide it to the right and tap the button 
Delete


.


At the end of this tutorial your Shopping list is ready.


Refer to the tutorial 
Sum
 (Total Purchased )to learn more about this section.
docs.title: Items

docs.text: After you follow the steps from the previous tutorial -  Custom Lists  - and create a new list you can start to add items to it.

It's possible to use the colour system to group items by section or similarity. This helps you to save time while doing your shopping. For that, slide it to the right and tap the button  Settings   In the same way, to delete an item, slide it to the right and tap the button  Delete  . docs.title: Edit or Delete an Item

docs.text:
Tutorial - Custom Lists


With 
Shopping List
 App you can create custom lists to better organize your shopping.


Create a New List


To create a new list, tap the button 'Add'




On the window 
Create a new list
, choose a color and type the name of the list. Then, tap 
Create
.




Don't worry about capitalizing the list's name. Type everything in lowercase, and the App will capitalize every word for you. For instance, if you type: 
my market
, the list will be created as 
My Market
.




You can also use numbers and 
emoji
 in the name of the list. 








If you try to use a name that already exists, the App will display a message: 
Ops, List name already exists






If you don't type anything or try to use special characters, such as {([.$#/])}, the App will display a message: 
Ops, you can't use {([.$#/])} or an empty list name






You can choose among five different colours to create your lists.




Edit or Delete a List


You can edit a list to change its name or its color. For that, slide it to the right and tap the button 
Settings




In the same way, to delete a list just slide it to the right and tap the button 
Delete




To delete 
all
 lists at once just tap the List Menu button (see image below) and select 
Remove all lists
.




At the end of this tutorial, you will have your Shopping list ready to be populated with its items.


Now refer to the tutorial 
Items
 to learn more about this section.
docs.title: Custom Lists

docs.text: With  Shopping List  App you can create custom lists to better organize your shopping.
docs.title: Tutorial - Custom Lists

docs.text: To create a new list, tap the button 'Add'   On the window  Create a new list , choose a color and type the name of the list. Then, tap  Create .   Don't worry about capitalizing the list's name. Type everything in lowercase, and the App will capitalize every word for you. For instance, if you type:  my market , the list will be created as  My Market .   You can also use numbers and  emoji  in the name of the list.      If you try to use a name that already exists, the App will display a message:  Ops, List name already exists    If you don't type anything or try to use special characters, such as {([.$#/])}, the App will display a message:  Ops, you can't use {([.$#/])} or an empty list name    You can choose among five different colours to create your lists.
docs.title: Create a New List

docs.text: You can edit a list to change its name or its color. For that, slide it to the right and tap the button  Settings   In the same way, to delete a list just slide it to the right and tap the button  Delete   To delete  all  lists at once just tap the List Menu button (see image below) and select  Remove all lists .   At the end of this tutorial, you will have your Shopping list ready to be populated with its items.  Now refer to the tutorial  Items  to learn more about this section.
docs.title: Edit or Delete a List

docs.text:
Tutorial - Sum


When you fill in the value and quantity for an item, the 
Shopping List
 App promptly displays the sum of you purchase. Similary, if you remove or change the value or quantity, the sum is updated.




The selection (
strikethrough
) of an item doesn't decrease its value from the sum.
docs.title: Sum

docs.text: When you fill in the value and quantity for an item, the  Shopping List  App promptly displays the sum of you purchase. Similary, if you remove or change the value or quantity, the sum is updated.   The selection ( strikethrough ) of an item doesn't decrease its value from the sum.
docs.title: Tutorial - Sum

docs.text:
Tutorial - Menu Options


At the upper-right corner of your lists you'll find a Menu with these five options:




Check all items


Uncheck all items


Remove all items values


Remove all checked items


Remove all items






Check all items


By tapping this option, you're selecting (
strikethrough
) all items from your list at once.




Just remember that the selection of an item doesn't decrease its value from the sum. This option is to help you to know what items are already purchased.




Uncheck all items


This option comes in handy when you want to 
reuse
 the list: you can deselect all items at once to use them again.


Remove all items values


This is another option for the 
reuse
 of the list: whether you want to reuse the entire list or just some of its items, you can remove all values at once and type them again when doing your next shopping.




This option changes all values to 0 (zero) and all 'qty' to 1 (one).




Remove all checked items


You can use this option to remove the items that you've purchased, but you don't want to buy them again using this same list.


Remove all items


This option clears your list. It makes your list like new so you can start a new one from scratch.
docs.title: Menu options

docs.text: At the upper-right corner of your lists you'll find a Menu with these five options:   Check all items  Uncheck all items  Remove all items values  Remove all checked items  Remove all items
docs.title: Tutorial - Menu Options

docs.title: Uncheck all items

docs.text: This is another option for the  reuse  of the list: whether you want to reuse the entire list or just some of its items, you can remove all values at once and type them again when doing your next shopping.   This option changes all values to 0 (zero) and all 'qty' to 1 (one).
docs.title: Remove all items values

docs.text: You can use this option to remove the items that you've purchased, but you don't want to buy them again using this same list.
docs.title: Remove all checked items

docs.title: Remove all items
